info.title: Incident Reporting API
info.description: API for viewing and managing incident reports

tags.name: Constants
tags.description: Constants and enumerations used in incident reports

tags.name: Questions and responses forming an incident report
tags.description: Create, retrieve and delete question-response pairs that form incident reports

tags.name: Incident reports
tags.description: Create, retrieve, update and delete incident reports

tags.name: Objects related to incident reports
tags.description: Create, retrieve, update and delete objects that are related to incident reports

tags.name: Migrate/Upsert NOMIS Incident Report
tags.description: Migrate or synchronise NOMIS incident report to Incident Report Service

tags.name: hmpps-queue-resource-async
tags.description: Endpoints that are to be used by administrators only for managing SQS queues. All endpoints require the QUEUE_ADMIN role further information can be found in the hmpps-spring-boot-sqs project

tags: Questions and responses forming an incident report
get.summary: Returns all non-historic questions in an incident report with their responses

parameters.description: The incident report id

200.description: Returns all questions and responses in report

tags: Questions and responses forming an incident report
put.summary: Add new questions with responses to the end of the current list or update them in place if question codes match
put.description: Requires role MAINTAIN_INCIDENT_REPORTS and write scope. Authentication token must provide a username which is recorded as the report’s modifier.

parameters.name: reportId
parameters.description: The incident report id

schema.description: List of question and responses to add or update in place

403.description: Missing required role. Requires the MAINTAIN_INCIDENT_REPORTS role with write scope.

200.description: Returns all questions and responses in report

tags: Questions and responses forming an incident report
delete.summary: Deletes questions (identified by code) from an incident report along with their responses
delete.description: Requires role MAINTAIN_INCIDENT_REPORTS and write scope. Authentication token must provide a username which is recorded as the report’s modifier.

parameters.name: reportId
parameters.description: The incident report id

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Codes for questions to delete

403.description: Missing required role. Requires the MAINTAIN_INCIDENT_REPORTS role with write scope.

requestBody.description: Incident report created or updated in NOMIS

get.summary: Returns pages of filtered incident reports (with only basic information)

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: Filter by given human-readable report reference

schema.description: Filter by given human-readable report reference

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Filter by given locations, typically prison IDs

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Filter by given information source

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by given statuses

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter by given incident types (not type families)

parameters.name: incidentDateFrom
parameters.description: Filter for incidents occurring since this date (inclusive)

schema.description: Filter for incidents occurring since this date (inclusive)

parameters.name: incidentDateUntil
parameters.description: Filter for incidents occurring until this date (inclusive)

schema.description: Filter for incidents occurring until this date (inclusive)

parameters.name: reportedDateFrom
parameters.description: Filter for incidents reported since this date (inclusive)

schema.description: Filter for incidents reported since this date (inclusive)

parameters.name: reportedDateUntil
parameters.description: Filter for incidents reported until this date (inclusive)

schema.description: Filter for incidents reported until this date (inclusive)

parameters.name: reportedByUsername
parameters.description: Filter for incidents reported by username

schema.description: Filter for incidents reported by username

parameters.name: involvingStaffUsername
parameters.description: Filter for incidents involving staff identified by username

schema.description: Filter for incidents involving staff identified by username

parameters.name: involvingPrisonerNumber
parameters.description: Filter for incidents involving prisoners identified by prisoner number

schema.description: Filter for incidents involving prisoners identified by prisoner number

parameters.name: userAction
parameters.description: Filter by last user actions derived from the most recent correction request on the report

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property,(asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

get.summary: Provides content for a prisoner to satisfy the needs of a subject access request on their behalf
get.description: Requires role SAR_DATA_ACCESS or additional role as specified by hmpps.sar.additionalAccessRole configuration.

parameters.name: prn
parameters.description: NOMIS Prison Reference Number

parameters.name: crn
parameters.description: nDelius Case Reference Number

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Optional parameter denoting minimum date of event occurrence which should be returned in the response

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Optional parameter denoting maximum date of event occurrence which should be returned in the response

403.description: Forbidden, requires an appropriate role

204.description: Request successfully processed - no content found

209.description: Subject Identifier is not recognised by this service

401.description: The client does not have authorisation to make this request

get.description: Returns the dataset for the given report ID and report variant ID filtered by the filters provided in the query.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
The filter query parameters have to start with the prefix "filters." followed by the name of the filter.
      For range filters, like date for instance, these need to be followed by a .start or .end suffix accordingly.
      For multiselect filters, these are passed as one query parameter per filter with a comma separated list of values:
      filters.someMultiselectFilter=a,b,c

parameters.name: dataProductDefinitionsPath
parameters.description:
This optional parameter sets the path of the directory of the data product definition files your application will use.
      "This query parameter is intended to be used in conjunction with the `dpr.lib.dataProductDefinitions.host` property to retrieve definition files from another application by using a web client.

403.description: Forbidden

x-no-data-warning.description: Provides additional information about why no data has been returned.

errorCode.description: When present, uniquely identifies the type of error making it easier for clients to discriminate without relying on error description or HTTP status code; see ` uk.gov.justice.digital.hmpps.incidentreporting.resource.ErrorCode` enumeration in hmpps-incident-reporting-api

code.description: The response code; used as a unique identifier within one report

response.description: The response text as seen by downstream data consumers

label.description: The response text as seen by the user at the point of entry

Omit or set to false for updates

location.description: The location where incident took place, typically a NOMIS prison ID

changedBy.description: The member of staff who changed the report type

ReportWithDetails.description: Incident report with all related information

historyOfStatuses.description: Previous statuses the incident report transitioned to

staffInvolved.description: Which members of staff were involved?

correctionRequests.description: The corrections that were requested of this report

staffInvolvementDone.description: Internal flag which, if false, is used to indicate that addition of staff involvements is unfinished

prisonerInvolvementDone.description: Internal flag which, if false, is used to indicate that addition of prisoner involvements is unfinished

nomisStatus.description: Previous NOMIS incident report status code, which may be null for statuses that cannot be mapped

nomisType.description: NOMIS incident report type code, which may be null for newer incident types

StaffInvolvement.description: Member of staff involved in an incident

sequence.description: Sequence of the staff involvement for this report

staffUsername.description: Username, absent for manually-added staff or those without NOMIS/DPS accounts

comment.description: Optional comment on staff member involvement

StatusHistory.description: Previous statuses an incident report transitioned to

status.description: Previous status of an incident report

changedAt.description: When the report status was changed

changedBy.description: The member of staff who changed the report status

nomisStatus.description: Previous NOMIS incident report status code, which may be null for statuses that cannot be mapped

AddStaffInvolvement.description: Add an involved member of staff to an incident report

staffUsername.description: Username, absent for manually-added staff or those without NOMIS/DPS accounts

comment.description: Optional comment on staff member involvement

AddPrisonerInvolvement.description: Add an involved prisoner to an incident report

AddDescriptionAddendum.description: Add to the description of an incident report by appending an addendum

createdBy.description: Username of user who added this addendum, defaulting to request token user

createdAt.description: When addendum was added, defaulting to “now”

firstName.description: First name of person that added this addendum

lastName.description: Last name of person that added this addendum

AddCorrectionRequest.description: Add a correction request to an incident report

location.description: The location where the staff member is raising the correction

userAction.description: Action taken by the user on the report

originalReportReference.description: Reference number of the original report of which this report is a duplicate of

userType.description: Type of user that submitted this action on the report

UpdateStaffInvolvement.description: Update an involved member of staff in an incident report

staffUsername.description: Username, absent for manually-added staff or those without NOMIS/DPS accounts– omit to preserve existing username, provide null to clear it

comment.description: Optional comment on staff member involvement – omit to preserve existing comment, provide null to clear it

UpdatePrisonerInvolvement.description: Update an involved prisoner in an incident report

outcome.description: Optional outcome of prisoner’s involvement – omit to preserve existing outcome, provide null to clear it

comment.description: Optional comment on prisoner’s involvement – omit to preserve existing comment, provide null to clear it

UpdateDescriptionAddendum.description: Update a description addendum in an incident report

createdBy.description: Username of user who added this addendum

createdAt.description: When addendum was added – omit to preserve existing date, provide null to set it to “now”

firstName.description: First name of person that added this addendum

lastName.description: Last name of person that added this addendum

UpdateCorrectionRequest.description: Update a correction request in an incident report

location.description: The location where the staff member is raising the correction

userAction.description: Action taken by the user on the report

originalReportReference.description: Reference number of the original report of which this report is a duplicate of

userType.description: Type of user that submitted this action on the report

UpdateReportRequest.description: Payload to update key properties of an incident report

location.description: The location where incident took place, typically a NOMIS prison ID

staffInvolvementDone.description: Internal flag which, if false, is used to indicate that addition of staff involvements is unfinished

prisonerInvolvementDone.description: Internal flag which, if false, is used to indicate that addition of prisoner involvements is unfinished

duplicatedReportId.description: ID of the original report of which this report is a duplicate of

ReportBasic.description: Incident report with only key information

id.description: The internal ID of this report

reportReference.description: The human-readable identifier of this report

location.description: The location where incident took place, typically a NOMIS prison ID

reportedBy.description: Username of person who created the incident report

reportedAt.description: When the incident report was created

status.description: The current status of this report

createdAt.description: When the report was first created

modifiedAt.description: When the report was last changed

modifiedBy.description: Username of the person who last changed this report

duplicatedReportId.description: ID of the original report of which this report is a duplicate of

latestUserAction.description: Latest user action from the most recent correction request

correctionRequest.description: The associated correction request associated with the status change

attachmentNumber.description: The number of the attachment which will match any corresponding reference in the content section

name.description: The name or description of the attachment which will be included in the report

contentType.description: The content type of the attachment

url.description: The url to be used to download the attachment file

filesize.description: The size of the attachment file in bytes

content.description: The content of the subject access request response

attachments.description: The details of any attachments for the subject access request response

totalElements.description: Total number of elements in all pages

numberOfElements.description: Number of elements in this page

familyCode.description: Machine-readable identifier for this family of incident types

code.description: Machine-readable identifier of this incident type

description.description: Human-readable description of this family of incident types (all incident types in one family share a description)

active.description: Whether this type is currently active and usable in new reports

nomisCode.description: Machine-readable NOMIS identifier of this incident type, which may be null for newer ones

ignoreDownstream.description: Whether reports with this status should be ignored downstream for most statistical purposes

nomisCode.description: Machine-readable NOMIS identifier of this value, which may be null for statuses that cannot be mapped

nomisCodes.description: Machine-readable NOMIS identifiers of this value, which may be empty for newer staff roles

nomisCode.description: Machine-readable NOMIS identifier of this value, which may be null for newer prisoner roles
Machine-readable NOMIS identifier of this value, which may be null for newer prisoner outcomes

ConstantDescription.description: Code and description of a constant or enumeration member
